page.title: 05St.Botolphs Church,Boston
page.content: The foundations of Boston Stump were laid in 1309.They say it was built on wool,they say it because the wool trade brought in more than enough money so they built a Church in name of St.Botolph who is supposed to have founded Boston.The height from the ground level to the tip of the tower is 272ft.The length of the Church is 282ft and the width is 100ft.The total area of the whole Church is more than 20,000 square ft.The knocker on the door dates back to the mid 12th century and it is older than the Church itself.Anyone who grasped the knocker was considered to come under the protection of the Church and so immune from arrest.The Church gained its nickname because the tower took so long to complete.
